Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 05:35PM Jubby46 wrote: oh wow my plan was surgery first then if I needed it chemo and last is radiation. Oh and you will afater week 3 or 4 get tired. Also with radiation you will get instructions to care for your skin because towards the end it will be like sunburn. So if you treat it the way they tell you it will not get that bad. I was told I can use corn starch and I did that this weekend and it helped.
Posts.Title: Pain under arm in the crease Jubby46 kcshreve

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 07:57PM Jubby46 wrote: no you don't feel a thing and you get zapped for maybe 3 to 5 minutes each time Toward the end you get a sunburn like thing I have not gotten it so bad use the moisturizer they tell you walk aroundthe house without a top to give your skin a chance to breathe
Posts.Title: Pain under arm in the crease Jubby46 kcshreve

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 05:25PM Jubby46 wrote: I had a sentinel node procedure done to locate the sentinel node. I had 3 removed all clear. Skin turning black is a normal occurrence. Ask for pain pills you will need them for a while depending on your tolerance for pain. It will get better in time. Lost my nipple. It was right under it so couldn't be helped. I have low tolerance for pain but it has gotten better as time goes by. You can email me if you want to keep in touch. The blackness doesn't hurt and the color will change back or stay. You can do research. It is from the radiation.  Radiation doesn't hurt. I did not have to go for chemo.
Posts.Title: Pain under arm in the crease Jubby46 kcshreve

Posts.Content: Jubby46 wrote: Hi all, New to this forum. What a great place. I had lumpectomy Jan 31. So I guess I am still healing. Starting 6th week of radiation. Under arm is turning black. I read that can happen. In the crease it is still raw. My upper arm swells and part of my upper arm seems numb. My shoulder and back hurt too. Asked doctor about sleeve and he said don't use. I am using corn starch and the moisturizer I am allowed to use. Wondering if there is anything else I can do. I can't sleep. Anti inflammatory helps for a while but who wants to live on them.  Seems like a great place to ask for help. thanks Dx 1/3/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR- Log in to post a reply
